hypothesis_content.title: SOL Momentum Cascade Post-Key Level Break
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL or BULL regime, if SOL breaks above a key, high-volume resistance level (defined as prior day's high with volume > 150% of 20-day average) in the first 2 hours of the US session (09:30-11:30 EST), a long entry will capture a continued momentum move for the remainder of the day.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-volume breaks of established levels in liquid altcoins like SOL during peak liquidity hours often trigger algorithmic and momentum follower buying, creating a self-reinforcing move that persists intraday.
entry_conditions: SOL price breaks above prior day's high
Break occurs on 1-hour volume > 150% of 20-day avg hourly volume
Entry on retest of broken level or next 1H open

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price falls back below the prior day's high
exit_conditions.time_exit: Market close (16:00 EST) on day of entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Average intraday return from entry to close is not statistically greater than zero (p-value > 0.05).
